front: What is the Big-O time complexity of binary search?

back: LIFO data structure. Push adds to top; pop removes top.
FIFO data structure: enqueue at rear, dequeue at front.
Not Found — the server can’t find the requested resource.

front: SQL: INNER JOIN vs LEFT JOIN
back: INNER: rows matching in both tables. LEFT: all rows from left table, NULLs when no right-side match.
Resolves human-readable domain names to IP addresses.
Merge keeps a merge commit; rebase rewrites commits onto a new base for a linear history.
Multiple identical requests have the same effect as one (e.g., GET, PUT, DELETE).
Use Anki’s Cloze model for {{c1::cloze deletions}} (not used with this Basic model).
